message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SE, cs.CY. 

The paper discusses a cryptographic construction for a decentralized public key infrastructure (PKI) that maintains high integrity and ensures authenticity and non-repudiation through the use of digital signatures. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses the use of authenticated data structures, namely hash chains and Merkle trees, which are commonly used in data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The concept of cross-referencing of ClaimChains is introduced, which relates to software engineering (cs.SE) and cryptography (cs.CY).
